subject: Public Speaking
title: Eisenhower's Military-Industrial Complex Warning
description: Learn Eisenhower's Military-Industrial Complex Warning in one minute.

hook.text: In 1961, a five-star general and outgoing president warned Americans about the military. Nobody expected that.

buildup.text: Eisenhower's farewell address coined the term military-industrial complex â€” a permanent alliance of defense and profit.

discovery.text: He argued that unchecked defense spending could warp democracy, science, and the economy for generations.

twist.text: The man who led D-Day was warning that the war machine he helped build had become dangerous to its own country.

climax.text: His speech was largely ignored at the time but became prophetic as defense budgets grew every decade since.

punchline.text: The general warned about generals. Nobody listened.

quiz.question: What term did Eisenhower coin in his farewell address?
